Most Useful Git Operations

28 MAY 2016 • 1 min read

I am nowhere near to be a git expert. After using ClearCase as the version control tool for over a year, git to me is an entirely new beast. One irritation I had using git was that it is pretty challenging to memorize all the commands beyond git add, commit, and push. I would usually them up again and again on StackOverflow, write them down on a scrap of paper and forget about them. Therefore, I am dedicating this post to sum up all the most used git operations for me.

Delete All the Untracked Files and Directories

git reset --hard HEAD
git clean -f -d

Undo git add –all

git reset

Deliver changes to a new side branch

git checkout -b <side branch name>
git add --all
git commit -m "<message>"
git push origin <side branch name>

Deliver a side branch to main branch

git checkout master
git pull origin master
git merge <side branch name>  // Testing: make sure everything works
git push origin master
